name: HttpRequestMethod
documentation:
Defines constants for standard and extended HTTP request methods used by Fluxzero's web handling system.

This interface provides:

  • String constants for standard HTTP verbs (e.g. {@code GET}, {@code POST})
  • Custom pseudo-methods for WebSocket lifecycle events (e.g. {@code WS_HANDSHAKE}, {@code WS_MESSAGE})
  • A wildcard constant ({@code *}) for method-agnostic routing
  • A helper method to detect whether a method is a WebSocket variant

Usage

These constants are used throughout the web routing and handler matching infrastructure:
  • In {@link WebPattern} to define method constraints
  • By {@link io.fluxzero.sdk.web.WebHandlerMatcher} during dispatch resolution
  • In {@link io.fluxzero.sdk.web.WebRequest} metadata to interpret incoming requests

The extended WebSocket methods are used internally to distinguish between phases of a WebSocket session, such as handshake negotiation, message delivery, or connection closure. @see WebPattern @see WebRequest @see io.fluxzero.sdk.web.WebsocketResponseInterceptor

fields.name: ANY
fields.documentation: Matches any HTTP method (wildcard). Useful for fallback routing.

fields.name: WS_CLOSE
fields.documentation: Represents an explicit closure of a WebSocket session.

fields.name: WS_HANDSHAKE
fields.documentation: Synthetic method representing a WebSocket handshake (initial HTTP upgrade).

fields.name: WS_MESSAGE
fields.documentation: Represents a message sent over an established WebSocket connection.

fields.name: WS_OPEN
fields.documentation: Represents the WebSocket session being formally opened after handshake.

fields.name: WS_PONG
fields.documentation: Represents a pong response received for a ping message.

methods.name: isWebsocket
